summary: The University of Cambridge, a prestigious public university in the United Kingdom, is highly selective with an undergraduate acceptance rate of 21.2%. The tuition fees vary based on a student's residency and chosen course. For UK/EU students, the annual tuition is approximately £9,535 (about $11,900 USD), while international students can expect to pay between £27,000 and £59,000 (about $33,700 to $73,700 USD). The university is globally recognized for its academic excellence, particularly in fields such as Medicine, Law, Economics, Computer Science, and Engineering. It operates on a unique collegiate system, providing students with a strong support network and personalized academic guidance.

undergraduate.gpa_requirement: N/A (UK system with equivalent high-level qualifications such as A-levels AAA to A*A*A)
undergraduate.ielts_requirement: 7.0 overall with minimum 6.5 in each component
undergraduate.essays_required: Yes, personal statement via UCAS and additional written work for some courses
undergraduate.supplemental_materials: Written work for certain courses; admissions tests required for many courses

costs.tuition_annual_usd: £9,535 (approximately $11,900) for UK/EU students; £27,000 to £59,000 (approximately $33,700 to $73,700) for international students depending on course
costs.total_cost_attendance: Approximately £17,385 to £66,535 ($21,600 to $83,400) depending on residency and course
costs.financial_aid_available: Yes, scholarships and bursaries available, highly competitive for international students

required_courses: Course-specific A-level or equivalent subjects with high grades (typically A*AA or AAA)
Foreign Language or Classical Language for some courses
recommended_courses: Further Mathematics encouraged for STEM courses
Additional A-levels or IB subjects recommended for broader preparation
admission_requirements.extracurricular_importance: Moderately considered; strong emphasis on academic excellence and potential

student_life.housing_guarantee: Many colleges guarantee accommodation for first-year students
student_life.dining_options: College dining halls with a variety of traditional and modern options
student_life.study_abroad_programs: Limited undergraduate study abroad, mainly postgraduate exchanges

special_features: One of the world's oldest and most prestigious universities
Collegiate system with over 30 autonomous colleges
Strong tutorial system ensuring personalized academic support
Global network of alumni and collaborations
